summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York dated January 10, 2020, summarizing clarifications provided by a witness (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) regarding her previous statements. The clarifications cover details about her marriage, interactions with Jeffrey Epstein, knowledge of investigations, and her legal representation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email is clarifications to her previous statements regarding her marriage age, interactions with Jeffrey Epstein, knowledge of media inquiries, and legal representation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to instructing someone to destroy evidence in Palm Beach, a 2018 meeting in New York about finances, and his knowledge of media inquiries.

persons.name: Noah
persons.context: Clarified to be 23 years old when he married the witness, who was 17 at the time.

persons.name: Johnny Stevenson
persons.context: Mentioned phonetically; prior to him, the witness had legal counsel chosen by Epstein.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email from the Southern District of New York, documenting witness clarifications.

connections.description: Maxwell recalls Epstein telling someone to destroy computers, directories, and photos in Palm Beach; she had a 2018 meeting with him in New York regarding finances and communicated with him about her husband's medical issues.
Clarification that Noah was 23 and Maxwell was 17 when they were married.
Stevenson represented Maxwell in the VR case, marking the first time she had her own legal representation separate from Epstein's chosen counsel.
Epstein's payment was reported on Maxwell's taxes, and they discussed financial issues in connection with her husband's medical problems.

events.title: Meeting with Epstein in New York
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell met with Jeffrey Epstein in New York to discuss financial issues.

events.title: Scheduled deposition that didn't occur
events.description: Maxwell was supposed to be deposed in November 2018 in a case, but she believes the case settled before that happened.

events.title: Tax return preparation
events.description: Prior to the 2019 tax returns, Maxwell's accountant had a conversation informing their understanding of who would pay taxes on money from Epstein.

events.title: Instruction to destroy evidence
events.description: Epstein told someone to get rid of computers, directories, and photos in Palm Beach; Maxwell's recollection is clear about the computers but not the directories and photos.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell clarified that her husband Noah was 23 (not 22) when they married, while she was 17.
Maxwell recalls Jeffrey Epstein instructing someone to destroy computers, and possibly directories and photos, in Palm Beach.
Epstein was aware of media inquiries from the Herald in April and November, as Maxwell had raised the fact that she had been asked for an interview.
Maxwell's first independent legal representation was for the VR case, with attorney Johnny Stevenson; prior to that, she had counsel chosen by Epstein.
Maxwell only went to Epstein's New York mansion when directed and did not have direct access prior to his incarceration.
